snippet: Palestinian and Israeli negotiators will meet in Jordan on Tuesday in an effort to revive moribund peace talks, although none of the sides involved suggested any reason to view the meeting as a sign of significant progress.
abstract: Palestinian and Israeli negotiators plan to meet for the first time in more than a year in an effort to revive moribund peace talks; neither side suggests any reason to view the upcoming meeting, to take place in Jordan, as a sign of significant progress.
lead_paragraph: Palestinian and Israeli negotiators will meet in Jordan on Tuesday in an effort to revive moribund peace talks, although none of the sides involved suggested any reason to view the meeting as a sign of significant progress.

headline.seo: Palestinians and Israelis to Hold Talks This Week
headline.main: Palestinians and Israelis Will Talk This Week
headline.print_headline: Palestinians and Israelis to Hold First Talks in Over a Year in Jordan
